name: Kepler-26
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-26 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-26 is a star with 0.54 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.51 times its radius. It is located 1104.20 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-26 is known to have 4 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-26 d

Kepler-26 d was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.04 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 3.54 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-26.

The mass of Kepler-26 d is 1.12 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-26 d is 1.07 that of Earth. At less than 1.5 Earth masses, Kepler-26 d is a regular terrestrial planet, much like the terrestrial planets we find in our solar system, namely Mercury, Venus, Earth and Mars.

Kepler-26 e

Kepler-26 e was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.22 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 46.83 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-26.

The mass of Kepler-26 e is 7.94 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-26 e is 2.41 that of Earth. At 7.94 Earth masses, Kepler-26 e is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

With a semi-major axis of 0.22 astronomical units, and a mass of 7.94 Earth masses, Kepler-26 e could, potentially, be a habitable planet with stable bodies of liquid water on its surface, like Earth.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-26, which contains 4 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
